bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

text.body:
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the Petition of No.5959 Hosaye Sakaguchi, MEMORANDUM OF /// for a Writ of habeas Corpus.
We desire to add to the contencion set out in the petition herein, the further contentions that the Board of Special Inquiry was not legally constituted. It appears from the record in the body of the return that the Board was composed of Frank S. Mounlion /// and B.A. Hunter, inspectors, and Wilbur S. Pacterson, stenographer,
Section 17 of the Immigration Act of Feb. 5 1917, provinces:
"That each Board of Special Inquiry skill consists of three members who shall be selected from such of the immigrant officers in the service as the Commissioner General of Immigration with the approval of the Secretary of Labor, shall from time to time designate as quialified to serve or such Boards."
The Board in the insuant cause appears to have been composed of two inpectors and a stenographer. We submit that this does not constitute a legal Board.
J.S. vs Redfern, 150 Fed. 500.
The statute uses the term officer, We submit that a stenographer is not an officer.
A pension /// clerk i not an official of the United States so as to disqualify him from membership in the state legislature.
State vs. Mason, 55 N.E.. 67
